results.title: Bryce - Zion - Grand Canyon
results.brief_description: A travelogue showing Bryce Canyon National Park in Southern Utah, Zion National Park (one mile away from Bryce Canyon) where the road pases through the mountain and the tunnel has “windows” cut through its sides which give amazing views of the canyon valley through to Pine Canyon. And finally, the Grand Canyon in Arizona where tourists on horse-back are taken into the canyon with guides. Shows the magnificent views of the canyon as seen from the buses touring along the roads. Edited by Eugene Castle.

results.title: Brute force and finesse: new ways of shaping and forming materials
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Max Morgan-Witts
results.brief_description: Recent advances in manufacturing techniques, including electron beam welding, explosive forming, spark machining, hydrostatic extrusion, and cold forming are demonstrated in this film.

results.title: Brush with royalty
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and David Poynter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A group of artists from Broken Hill prepare for an exhibition of their work in London. Artists include Pro Hart and Jack Absalom, and all use the countryside around Broken Hill as their source of inspiration. This film is recommended for students in Years 9-12.

results.title: Brush techniques
results.brief_description: This is the second of a series of films on water colour painting which have been made in collaboration with Eliot O’Hara; the companion film, the first in the series, is “Painting reflections in water”. In “Brush techniques”, O’Hara executes a water colour sketch in order to demonstrate how he communicates his impression of a landscape to whose who view his paintings.

results.title: Brush Creek bounces back
results.creator_credit: State of West Virginia, Dept of Commerce and Stuart Finley
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the Brush Creek Small Watershed Project converted the valley into an award winning example of good conservation practices. This enhanced land values, provided new recreation facilities and created new jobs.

results.title: Bruno, L'enfant du Dimanche = Bruno, Sunday's Child
results.brief_description:
Thirteen-year old Bruno sees his father one Sunday in each month. During the August holidays, father and son spend a long weekend together in Belgium. This is a very slight but touching film about a father-son relationship which sensitively delineates the problems each faces in their difficult situation. Careful direction avoids the pitfalls of cloying sentiment, Hanin’s performance is beautifully judged, and the Bruges locations are pleasing. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Louis Grospierre ; writers, Louis Grospierre, Alain Quercy ; photography, Quinto Albicocco ; music, Jean-Pierre Bourtayre ; editor, Leonide Azar.
Cast: Roger Hanin, Christian Mesnier, Marika Green, Mary Marquet, Pascale Roberts, Francine Berge.

results.title: Brunelleschi's architecture
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and Edward Hayward
results.brief_description: Looks at the works of Italian Renaissance architect, Brunelleschi. Discusses the importance of his invention of the modern system of perspective and his completely new architectural style. Commentary by Howard Burns.
results.description: Looks at the works of Italian Renaissance architect, Brunelleschi. Discusses the importance of his invention of the modern system of perspective and his completely new architectural style. Commentary by Howard Burns.

results.title: Spotlights: Bruna Papandrea
results.brief_description: Eric Banadinović AM, known professionally as Eric Bana, is an Australian actor. He began his career in the sketch comedy series Full Frontal (1993–97) before gaining notice in the comedy/drama The Castle (1997) before gaining critical acclaim as the lead in Chopper (2000).
results.description: Bruna Papandrea is an Australian film and television producer and the founder of production company Made Up Stories, which is set to release the upcoming adaptation of Liane Moriarty’s Nine Perfect Strangers. Prior to Made Up Stories, Papandrea co-founded the production company, Pacific Standard, with Reese Witherspoon, which produced Gone Girl and Big Little Lies.
description_for_label: Bruna Papandrea is an Australian film and television producer and the founder of production company Made Up Stories, which is set to release the upcoming adaptation of Liane Moriarty’s Nine Perfect Strangers. Prior to Made Up Stories, Papandrea co-founded the production company, Pacific Standard, with Reese Witherspoon, which produced Gone Girl and Big Little Lies.

details.label: Curatorial section

results.title: Brumby: Horse Run Wild
results.creator_credit: Sky Visuals, Australian Screen Associates, ABC-TV (Australia), Discovery Channel and Gary Steer
results.brief_description: Horses were brought to Australia 200 years ago as servants and loyal friends. Having served faithfully in work and war, they were turned loose. They ran wild, were named “Brumby” and branded outlaws. This wild, beautiful and noble animal is a threat to the natural environment. Brumbies are mustered and shot from helicopters, and this film contains scenes of shootings. However, the greatest killer of brumbies is drought - but they are as wild as the land in which they live, and they have a strong instinct to survive. Narrated by Bryan Brown.

results.title: Brum to the rescue and other stories
results.brief_description: Brum is a miniature 1920’s style vintage car. Too small to travel on the roads, Brum prefers the safety of the footpaths and byways. Full of fun - and just a little bit naughty! - Brum’s curiosity leads him into all sorts of adventures as he journeys out into the big world. Meet Brum in the following four delightful episodes contained in this video: “Brum to the rescue” - Brum rescues a little girl from two bullying children. “Brum and the kite” - Learning to fly a kite leads Brum on a funny chase all over town. “Brum and the car breakers” - Brum breaks down in a rubbish dump, and is taken to the car breaker’s yard. “Brum at the Opera” - Brum accidentally finds his way on to the stage during an opera performance.
